elements.title: Carnegie Hall Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before Carnegie Hall Tower (pictured) was built, pianos at Carnegie Hall were carried up staircases because the hall did not have a freight elevator?

elements.title: Iulia Maria Dan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Romanian soprano Iulia Maria Dan was Hamlet's Ophelia in the Bregenz Festival's revival of Franco Faccio's revived opera Amleto?

elements.title: phenprocoumon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that taking St John's wort can weaken the effects of the blood thinner phenprocoumon?

elements.title: Vitaly Shishov (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Belarusian activist Vitaly Shishov, the head of an organisation helping people escape repression following the 2020–2021 Belarusian protests, was aware of risks to his life before he was found dead?

elements.title: 2008 World Snooker Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that both finalists at the 2008 World Snooker Championship made maximum breaks during the tournament?

elements.title: Holothuria hilla (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the sea cucumber Holothuria hilla reproduces by fission, the regenerated part is often paler in colour than the original one?

elements.title: Tobias Adrian (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that IMF economist Tobias Adrian helped devise CoVaR, a method used to stress-test banks after the Great Recession?

elements.title: Cook Islands National Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1999 two necklaces were repatriated to the Cook Islands National Museum from a museum in Angus, Scotland?
